channel.title: Basics of Linux on My IT notes in a wiki
channel.description: Recent content in Basics of Linux on My IT notes in a wiki

item.title: Rename, move, copy & past files
item.description: This is already a good start, with 1 command you can perform 2 different things. Rename and move files mv (option) filename1.ext filename2.ext mv (option) /folder/who/rename/ /folder/who/renamed/ Moves the filename1.ext and/or renames it to filename2.ext. move mv /home/user/files/filename.ext /etc/filename.ext mv /home/user/files/ /etc/files/ rename mv /home/user/files/filename.ext /home/user/files/new_filename.ext mv /home/user/files/ /etc/user/new_files/ combination mv /home/user/files/filename.ext /etc/new_filename.ext mv /home/user/files/ /etc/new_files/
